intro: Liatris novae-angliae f. alba, commonly known as the white panicled blazing star, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, spike-like inflorescence composed of white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wet meadows and marshes. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces seeds in small, dry fruits called achenes. This cultivar is prized for its ornamental value and ecological benefits in native plant gardens.
